result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley T Nero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Bradley T Nero in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:
Sentence of:
9 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit -61 days).  Commences immediately, to report on his own because he is currently in Huber on another matter.
COSTS:  WAIVED
DNA Already done. 
BUY MONEY $260.00 to the Waukesha Police Department to be paid within 180 days failure to pay will result in a civil judgment 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
